text: [Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm Zed a technical customer
service associate here at the AWS office
in Cape Town today I'm going to show you
what to do when your payment method is
declined let's get
started there are a few reasons why your
credit card or payment method might be
declined when paying an AWS Bill your
credit card is expired or the
information on file is incorrect your
credit card is not an accepted payment
method for your AWS salov record your
payment method has transaction or
balance limits your payment issuer
requires additional verification or
authentication let's go through how to
resolve each of these
issues log into your AWS ping
console in the navigation bin choose
payment
preferences review your listed payment
methods
check whether your credit card is
expired or has incorrect information if
your payment method shows as unverified
chose
verify if your credit card isn't an
accepted payment method then you must
add a new one that is accepted by your
aw Salo record you can view your aw Salo
record under payer account in payment
preferences contact your bank to request
higher limits for AWS charges discuss
any additional concerns with your bank
such as how to use the authentication
process for AWS UDP accounts you might
need to complete additional credit card
payment verification steps if your bank
requires additional verification you
will be redirected to your bank's
website follow the instructions from
your bank to complete these processes
for cards that require 3D secure
authenication check whether this is
support in your AWS region and ask your
bank to wait this requirement if
needed after you've resolved the core
issue retry your payment for further
issues contact AWS support be sure that
you provide the detailed troubleshooting
steps that you have already
tried so now you know how to identify
and resolve issues when your credit card
or payment method is declined for an AWS
PLL
payment thanks for watching and happy
cloud computing from all of us here at
AWS
[Applause]
[Music]
